subject: Re: Why must test methods return void?
msgSnippet: ... +1 for that change. As it seems, most IDEs and tools work fine with non-void test methods but fail on test methods with parameters. JExample only received
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> I think this would be a trivial change internally to JUnit. I'm not sure how many external tools have the "void only" assumption baked in and how many rely on JUnit for validation.

+1 for that change.

As it seems, most IDEs and tools work fine with non-void test methods but fail on test methods with parameters. JExample only received bug reports regarding the latter.

--AA
